title: Tashan Daniel: Two men, 21 and 19, charged with murder of Arsenal fan
text:
Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Two men have been charged with the murder of an Arsenal fan who had been on his way to watch the team when he was stabbed to death.

Alex Lanning, 21, of Uxbridge, and Jonathan Camille, 19, of Kensington, have both been charged with murdering Tashan Daniel , British Transport Police said in a statement this evening.

They will both appear in court on Monday.

An 18-year-old woman from West Drayton, who was arrested on suspicion of assisting an offender, has been released under police investigation.

Tashan, 20, was on his way to watch Arsenal play Nottingham Forest on September 24 when he was stabbed to death at Hillingdon London Underground station.

He had received the tickets two days earlier for his 20th birthday.

(Image: PA)

(Image: Facebook)

Before leaving for the game he had lunch with his mum and took his granddad to a taster session at a day care centre.

Dad Chandy added: "He swapped an appointment around because he knew how important it was to the family. He put his Arsenal shirt on, I was doing something on the computer and he was helping me.

"He was short on time - he ruffled my hair, gave me a kiss on the cheek and that's the last time he left home."

Members of the public as well as paramedics and police officers tried to save the aspiring athlete, but he died on board a Tube carriage.

(Image: PA)

Tashan's mum Celia arrived at the station minutes after the stabbing but was stopped from immediately going down until police officers realised who she was.

Celia, 48, said: "Paramedics shook their head and I knew he was gone, I collapsed but I begged him, 'could I please hold his hand'."

She was allowed to hold his hand "for a tiny second".
description: Alex Lanning, 21, of Uxbridge, and Jonathan Camille, 19, of Kensington, have both been charged with murder
